definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
Dabancheng district of Urumqi city 烏魯木齊市|乌鲁木齐市[Wu1 lu3 mu4 qi2 Shi4], Xinjiang
Dabancheng district of Urumqi city 烏魯木齊市|乌鲁木齐市[Wu1 lu3 mu4 qi2 Shi4], Xinjiang
old name for Ōsaka 大阪 (city in Japan), changed in the beginning of the Meiji 明治 Era because 坂 could, if the radicals were read separately, be interpreted as "(will) return to soil"
famous scene in Romance of the Three Kingdoms in which Zhao Yun 趙雲|赵云 charges seven times through the ranks of Cao Cao's armies

sentences.english: The old streets and shops in Sannen-zaka, Kyoto, still retain their original character. (Frank Carter/LPI)
sentences.chinese: 在京都三年坂，老街和商铺依然保持着原始面貌。

sentences.english: Well, Sugi , walk up toward Sakamoto's tipsy house and look for Dr.
sentences.chinese: 那么，杉，到坂本家的醉屋去找三蒲医生吧。

definition: name of a river/rushing of water
Wen River in northwest Sichuan (same as 汶川)/classical name of river in Shandong, used to refer to Qi 齊國|齐国
used in Japanese names with phonetic value hatake, bata etc/dry field (i.e. not paddy field)

mound/burial mound/senior (i.e. eldest child or senior in rank)
abbr. for Sichuan Province 四川[Si4 chuan1] in southwest China
